required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Pharmacokinetics of SNX-001 in Healthy Aged Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 1 Safety and Pharmacokinetics of Methane Sulfonylfluoride (MSF or SNX-001) After Single and Multiple Oral Dose Administration in Healthy Adult Aged Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a randomised, double-blind, group-sequential, placebo-controlled, safety and pharmacokinetic study in healthy, aged volunteers.
Objectives:
1. to confirm the previously reported safety profile of oral SNX-001 after single and multiple doses of 3.6, 7.2 or 10.8 mg compared to placebo
2. to establish SNX-001 pharmacokinetic profile.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is an exploratory study designed as a group sequential single and multiple escalating dose, double-blind within cohort, randomized, placebo controlled study to investigate the safety and tolerability as well as the pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics of SNX-001 given as oral doses in aged volunteers.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Relationship of clinical safety measurements to dose
primary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout 14-day study period (Days 1, 2, 3, 10, 12, 13, 14) and 7 days after last dose (Day 21)
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events (AEs), vital signs, electrocardiogram (ECG), Acetylcholinesterase (AChE) inhibition, laboratory parameters after single and multiple dose administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of dose on pharmacokinetic (PK) parameters
secondary_outcome.description: Pharmacokinetic parameters after single and multiple dose administration of SNX-001 (3.6, 7.2 and 10.8 mg)

intervention.description: 3.6, 7.2, or 10.8 mg single dose or t.i.w.
Same volumes and frequency as active.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy males or females
- Physically and mentally healthy subjects
- Body weight >60 kg and body weight â‰¤ 100 kg
Exclusion Criteria:
- Evidence of any clinically significant hepatic, renal, gastrointestinal, cardiovascular, pulmonary, haematological, psychiatric, neurological or other significant acute or chronic abnormalities
- History of general malignant diseases
- Evidence of myasthenic weakness
- Acute infection or any other febrile illness
